citeinfo.title: E2NHDPlusV2_us: Database of Ancillary Hydrologic Attributes and Modified Routing for NHDPlus Version 2.1 Flowlines

descript.abstract: The National Hydrography Dataset Plus, Version 2 (NHDPlusV2) is an attribute rich, digital hydrologic network for the Conterminous U.S. developed by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). SPAtially Referenced Regressions On Watershed attributes (SPARROW), is a process-based/statistical model that relies on a digital hydrologic network, like NHDPlusV2, in order to establish spatial relations between monitored contaminant loads, contaminant sources, and other watershed characteristics. The USGS National Water Quality Assessment (NAWQA) project adopted the medium-resolution NHDPlusV2 network as the primary framework supporting SPARROW modeling, and has become a unifying system for reporting hydrologic information. This metadata describes enhancements made to improve the routing capabilities and ancillary hydrologic attributes of NHDPlusV2 to support modeling and other hydrologic analyses. The resulting enhanced network is named E2NHDPlusV2_us.
descript.purpose: These data represent a topologically reconditioned version of the NHDPlusV2 routing network (McKay and others, 2012), including enhanced attributes to improve flow routing and the physical description of flowlines. The modifications pertain only to NHDPlus data table values; no physical changes were made to the spatial locations of flowlines or catchments. The approach assumes the pre-existence of the NHDPlus network and its attributes, although many of the attributes can be generated without reference to existing values. The enhanced dataset, named E2NHDPlusV2_us, represents a national framework useful for the hydrologic referencing of spatial data, and is an extension of the work in Schwarz and Wieczorek, 2018. The data are useful to hydrologic modeling, such as the SPARROW water-quality model, and other analyses relating spatial features to hydrologic data.
descript.supplinf: Details of methods are described in Brakebill and others, 2019, and in Schwarz and Wieczorek, 2018.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

citeinfo.title: An Enhanced Hydrologic Stream Network Based on the NHDPlus Medium Resolution Dataset

attracc.attraccr: The upstream basin areas were calculated for divergence routed and total upstream accumulations and compared to basin areas published in the NHDPlusV2 data suite (Brakebill and others, 2019).

dataqual.logic: A series of checks were performed on the master E2NHDPlusV2_us database file to ensure the logical consistency of the modifications, such as: 1) ensuring only one flowline at a diversion was coded as the primary pathway, 2) diversion fractions across the pathways sum to one, and 3) the flow connectivity of the network was not compromised by altering the flow direction after reordering the network with the revised HYDROSEQ numbers (Brakebill and others, 2019).
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set was not conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set was not conducted.

citeinfo.title: Database of modified routing for NHDPlus version 2.1 flowlines: ENHDPlusV2_us

srcinfo.srccontr: Compilation of original NHDPlus files and attributes.

citeinfo.title: An Enhanced Hydrologic Stream Network Based on the NHDPlus Medium Resolution Dataset

procstep.procdesc: NHDPlusV2 data were downloaded from EPA (Brakebill and others, 2019; McKay and others, 2012). Download nhdplusv2 using the program get_nhdplus_files.py located in the scripts.zip folder.

Below is a sequential description of SAS scripts executed to make and modify network routing and ancillary attributes. Processing took place between March, 2015 and March 2017. SAS Scripts used to modify attributes and create the E2NHDPlusV2_us data file are located in the scripts.zip folder. To replicate the development process, run the following SAS scripts sequentially (1 - 18) in the listed order. Some scripts require user created ancillary information stored in .xlsx files (AREvents_final7.xlsx and div_modify.xlsx), and are noted below. These files and associated readme files for further explanation are located in the supplemental_files.zip file.
All SAS scripts have extensive comment information regarding settings and function for the script. Please see these sections, grouped by /* and */ comment symbols throughout the scripts for more details.
1. make_nhdplusv2.sas - merges all downloaded NHDPlus files into single data set and generates compact values for from and to nodes.
2. fix_nhdplusv2.sas - fills in missing values, fixes known errors. Attributes were renamed, duplicate observations removed, missing values corrected, revisions to routing including adjustments to diversion codes and fraction of flow diverted. These corrections are described in detail in the ENHDPlusV2_us metadata (Schwarz and Wieczorek, 2018) and in Brakebill and others, 2019).
2a. Make a Backup of the network from above, called rnhdplusv2_us
3. make_shapefile_selectpoints.sas - reads NHDPlusV2 flowline shapefiles and outputs point locations (lat/lon) of nodes and midpoint
4. make_nhdplus_ifextterm.sas - reads NHD nodes lat/lon file from above (#3) and identifies flowlines that terminate at US border
5. mod_nhdplus_arevents.sas - reads AREvents_final7.xlsx and modifies NHDPlus to account for AR events - creates new virtual flowlines for select transfers. Addition and removal (AR) events were documented in the file ARevents_final7.xlsx file and described. This file captures user determination of the location and amount of flow diverted as described in Brakebill and others, 2019. Not all attributes are preserved in the resulting E2NHDPlusV2_us file. These attributes are described in the .xlsx file AREvents.xlsx. Pesudo flowlines were added in AREvents_final7.xlsx so the routing could be included in the network routing. Pseudo flowlines were assigned COMIDs in a special range (less than -90000000) to distinguish them in the network from standard flowlines. Pseudo flowlines also were assigned a length of zero, the implication being that no instream losses could occur on the pseudo portion of the revised network, which would be consistent with the assumed properties of routed transfers. Multiple pseudo flowlines were permitted to merge either at a common node of the pseudo network or as discharge to a common node on the NHDPlusV2 network. From and To-nodes may be created to support the pseudo flowlines for routed transfers in the AR process. These nodes were assigned as the next sequential numbers beyond the maximum values of the both the compactified nodes and regular nodes. Therefore, these nodes are both unique and automatically compact. Disconnected AR withdrawal/discharge events (including non-routed transfers) were assumed to connect to the specific flowline they reference. ARQuantity describes the amount of flow withdrawn or diverted. Compact sequential hydrologic sequence values are assigned upstream order (largest value is upstream) and stored in HYDROSEQ.
6. mod_nhdplus_routing.sas - reads div_modify.xlsx and modifies NHDPlus routing and diversions. Diversion affected flowlines were cataloged in the file div_modify.xlsx. This file documents a list of modified diversion codes and diversion fractions that were updated in the E2NHDPlusV2_us dataset. This file is created by the user, as described in Brakebill and others, 2019. The file is read by the SAS program mod_nhdplus_routing.sas, and alterations to the diversion code (divergence), the diversion fraction (DivFrac), and direction of flow (HYDROSEQ, from and to-nodes) are modified based on these values. Compact sequential hydrologic sequence values are assigned upstream order (largest value is upstream) and stored in HYDROSEQ. Any additional updates to the network would require a new file created containing the modifications. See readme_diversion.txt in the supplemental_files.zip.
7. make_nhdplus_usarea.sas - creates share (fraction) of incremental and cumulative area in US variables
8. make_nhdplus_divvars.sas - creates the diversion affected flowline variables
9. merge_nhdplus_files.sas - merges ancillary data sets usarea divvars with nhdplus file (usarea divvars)
10. make_nhdplus_totvars.sas - creates total and cumulative upstream variables [generates index files to speed subsequent processing]
11. merge_nhdplus_files.sas - Modify "%let ancil_files =" line to merge ancillary data set totvars with nhdplus file (totvars) created using previously run scripts noted above
12. make_nhdplus_pctunrslvd.sas - creates variable percent unresolved area due to diversions
13. make_nhdplus_vaavars.sas - creates value added attribute variables
14. make_nhdplus_elevvars.sas - creates slope and elevation variables
15. make_nhdplus_flowvel.sas - creates flow and velocity variables
16. merge_nhdplus_files - Modify "%let ancil_files =" line to merge all (pctunrslvd vaavars elevvars flowvel) created using previously run scripts noted above
17. make_nhdplus_regions.sas - creates regional breakout dbf files for use with GIS
18. revise_postmod_nhdplus.sas - Alternatively, can execute scripts numbered 1-6 (noted above) individually and then run revise_postmod_nhdplus. Program combines individual programs to update subsets of NHDPlus variables in response to routing revisions implemented by the mod_nhdplusV2.sas program.
For additional modifications to routing or AR events (number 5 and 6 above), create new Excel files: div_modify.xlsx and AREvents_final7.xlsx containing only the new changes. Then run scripts 5 and 6 and then the revise_postmod_nhdplus.sas program (18).
Details of methods are described in Brakebill and others, 2019, and in Schwarz and Wieczorek, 2018.

enttyp.enttypd: Zipped Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data.

attr.attrdef: Unique feature identifier from NHDPlus source data.
Unique identifier for flowline (negative FL_COMID = closed catchment) taken from source data item, COMID.
Flowline Geographic Names Information System Identifier (GNIS) taken from source data.
GNIS name, specific term, or expression by which a flowline is known

attrdomv.udom: Name identified by GNIS. Some may be blank as the name may not be identified.

attr.attrdef: Flowline length
Unique flowline identifier. The first eight digits are the Watershed Boundary Dataset(WBD) HUC8.The next six digits are randomly assigned, sequential numbers that are unique within a HUC8.
Unique identifier for waterbody taken from NHDWaterbody polygon table item, COMID.
Numeric code for flowline feature attributes; definitions for codes found in the NHDFCode lookup table.

attrdomv.udom: 55800 - ARTIFICIAL PATH, feature type only: no attributes 33600 - CANAL/DITCH, feature type only: no attributes 33601 - CANAL/DITCH, Canal/Ditch Type|aqueduct 33603 - CANAL/DITCH, Canal/Ditch Type|stormwater 56600 - COASTLINE, feature type only: no attributes 33400 - CONNECTOR, feature type only: no attributes 42800 - PIPELINE, feature type only: no attributes 42801 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|aqueduct; Relationship to Surface|at or near 42802 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|aqueduct; Relationship to Surface|elevated 42803 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|aqueduct; Relationship to Surface|underground 42804 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|aqueduct; Relationship to Surface|underwater 42805 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|general case; Relationship to Surface|at or near 42806 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|general case; Relationship to Surface|elevated 42807 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|general case; Relationship to Surface|underground 42808 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|general case; Relationship to Surface|underwater 42809 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|penstock; Relationship to Surface|at or near 42810 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|penstock; Relationship to Surface|elevated 42811 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|penstock; Relationship to Surface|underground 42812 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|penstock; Relationship to Surface|underwater 42813 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|siphon; Relationship to Surface|unspecified 42814 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|general case 42815 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|penstock 42816 - PIPELINE, Pipeline Type|aqueduct 46000 - STREAM/RIVER, feature type only: no attributes 46003 - STREAM/RIVER, Hydrographic Category|intermittent 46006 - STREAM/RIVER, Hydrographic Category|perennial 46007 - STREAM/RIVER, Hydrographic Category|ephemeral 42000 - UNDERGROUND CONDUIT, feature type only: no attributes 42001 - UNDERGROUND CONDUIT, Positional Accuracy|definite 42002 - UNDERGROUND CONDUIT, Positional Accuracy|indefinite 42003 - UNDERGROUND CONDUIT, Positional Accuracy|appoximate

attr.attrdef: NHDPlus production region code.
Unique identifier of a flowline feature type taken from NHDFlowline feature class.

edom.edomvd: Addition or Removal of water event.

attr.attrdef: Flag denoting if flowline is in a digitized network, 0 is not in a digitized network; 1 is in a digitized network taken from NHDFlowline feature class item, "FlowDir," 1 = "with Digitized" and 0 = "Uninitialized.
Stream (flowline) level (lower valued stream levels are the mainstem and the higher valued stream levels are the tributaries, coast = 0, terminus = 1, ground/international border = 4).
Strahler Stream Order
Major path Strahler stream order, Coast = 0.
Original NHDPlusV2 from node identifier
Original NHDPlusV2 to node identifier.
Hydro sequence (upstream order) identifier
Level path (Hydroseq number identifier for most downstream FL_COMID in path)
Hydroseq number identifier of terminal FL_COMID in path. Higher numbers in sequence denote upstream reaches and lower numbers in sequence denote downstream reaches.
Total upstream flowline length in kilometers(km)
Divergence code (0 for no diversion, 1 for primary pathway, and 2 for secondary pathway).
If flowline is headwater
If terminate at coast/ground/border
Reachcode measure at downstream node (0-100)
Reachcode measure at upstream node (0-100)
Incremental flowline drainage area (km2)
Total upstream area (km2)
Cumulative div-based drainage area (km2)
Diversion fraction, estimated fraction of flow diverted through pathway.
Maximum catchment raw elevation (cm)
Minimum catchment raw elevation (cm)
Max catchment smoothed elevation (cm)
Min catchment smoothed elevation (cm)
Channel slope (vert length/horiz length)
Area upstream of headwater node (km2)
Incremental catchment area (km2) including sinks
If closed catchment
Mean annual precipitation (mm*100)
Mean annual temperature (deg C*100)
Mean annual runoff (mm)
Cumulative mean annual flow using unit flow runoff method
Stream velocity at mean annual flow (f/s)
Incremental catchment mean annual flow (unit runoff method,cfs)
Waterbody Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) identifier
Waterbody GNIS name (<=65 char)

attrdomv.udom: Name of feature as defined by GNIS.

attr.attrdef: Waterbody area (km2)
Waterbody elevation (f)
Waterbody feature code
Waterbody feature type abbreviation
Flag to identify if source waterbody data were from the NHDAREA file

edom.edomvd: Yes, waterbody data were from the NHDAREA file

attr.attrdef: WB feature alternative NHDPlusreg in cases where waterbodies were in multiple regions
Compactified from node
compactified to node
Flag used to identify AR events that initiate outside the region to which the NHDComid flowline resides

attrdomv.udom: NHDPlusV2 production region code for the initial point of the event

attr.attrdef: For withdrawal events (ToComid is blank), this is flow (cfs) removed from the FromComid; for transfer events with both FromComid and ToComid specified, this is the flow originally in FromComid that is routed through ToComid (note, it does not necessarily equal the flow in ToComid as there may be other upstream FromComid's that route to the same ToComid; for discharge to the non-virtual network (ToComid is > 0), this is the flow added to ToComid (in addition to flow that is already in the ToComid).
Unconnected, withdrawal events (ARDWType = 1, 2, or 3), and equals the ratio of ARQuantity to ARQFrom. ARFrom is stored in the AREvents_Final7.xlsx user defined worksheet.

Value is 1 if a routed transfer (transfer with either FromComid or ToComid in the -90000000s), 2 if withdrawal (public supply, irrigation, or non-routed transfer), and 3 if discharge (public supply, irrigation, or non-routed transfer).

edom.edomvd: a routed transfer (transfer with either FromComid or ToComid in the -90000000s)
withdrawal is public supply, irrigation, or non-routed transfer.
discharge is public supply, irrigation, or non-routed transfer.

attr.attrdef: Withdrawal/discharge type. (IfPublic = 1); 2 if (IfIrr = 1); and 3 if a (both IfPublic and IfIrr are 0).

edom.edomvd: Withdrawal/discharge is associated with public supply

attr.attrdef: Descriptive name for the AR event component.
Flowline catchment area in US
If flwline terminates at US border (0/1)
Pre-modification hydro sequence
Archival version of HYDROSEQ as revisions were made as of January 20, 2017.
Modified value of diversion fraction
If modified to reverse (correct) flow direction

edom.edomvd: flowline from and to nodes reversed in order to change direction of flow

attr.attrdef: Flag identifying diversion pathway, computed January 20, 2017.
Fraction of flow diverted, computation as of January 20, 2017.
Amount cumareakm2 (area) in US (km2)
Percent cumareakm2 not in US (% Foreign drainage)
If flowline terminates to ground (0/1)
If all downstream flowpaths terminate into the ground

edom.edomvd: all downstream flowlines do not terminate
all downstream flowlines terminate to the ground

attr.attrdef: If unresolved diversion path
Flag noting if major path on a non-terminating flowline into the ground is on an unresolved diversion

edom.edomvd: No, major path on a non-terminating flowline into the ground is not on an unresolved diversion
Yes, major path on a non-terminating flowline into the ground is on an unresolved diversion

attr.attrdef: Flag noting if a flowline terminates into the ground and has a non-terminating into the ground upstream of it

edom.edomvd: Does not terminate into ground, and does not have any flowlines upstream terminating into ground.
Flowline terminates to ground, and has upstream flowlines terminating to ground.

attr.attrdef: Flag identifies non-TermGround/non-DivUnrslvd flowlines that are on pathways that connect multiple Div2Ground flowlines that, themselves, intersect prior to interior termination
Flag noting if divergence-affected flowline is resolved with modified DIVFRAC value
Hydro-independent diversion group id

An index of uncertainty of flow due to unresolved diversions. The index is defined only for flowlines with Div2Ground equal to 0 and is equal to 100 times the difference between total upstream area (given by the NHDPlusV2 TotAreaKm2 variable) and the cumulative upstream area
Flag to identify method used to compute slope

edom.edomvd: slope was determined directly by elevations at both the upstream and downstream node the case where both nodes are set points
slope was estimated by interpolation, where at least one of the flowlines nodes is not a set point
slope was estimated by the regression method

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Biological Data Profile of the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
